Arches,
You will have a better chance for a solution when you
post this problem to 
Eclipse support.

Your Eclipse installation is failing before you're
doing anything with 
JUnit.

Regards, Jan

----- Original Message ----- 
From: arches73
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, June 14, 2006 11:17 PM
Subject: [junit] Eclipse is closed automatically when
tried to add Junit


Hi

I have Eclipse 3.1 installed in my windows XP PC.
I tried to add Junit.Jar file
using the following method given in the site
http://open.ncsu.edu/se/tutorials/junit/#section1_0

"1.1.1 Right click on the project and select
Properties.
In the left column select Java Build Path.
To the right select the Libraries tab.
Click the Add External JARs... button.
You should start off in the Eclipse install directory,
otherwise search through the file system until you
find
the Eclipse install directory"

But as soon as I click "Add external JARs" it closes
eclipse
window and comes out.

Appreciate any input on this. Do I need to do any
setups
or version mismatch..?

Thanks
Arches
